thread.title: The Latest from NFL Week 7: An experiment with streaming
thread.title_full: The Latest from NFL Week 7: An experiment with streaming - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: The Latest from NFL Week 7: An experiment with streaming
text:
Photo: Tim Ireland, AP Image 1 of / 1   1 Spectators pose for photos on Wembley Way as they arrive for the NFL game between Buffalo Bills and Jacksonville Jaguars at Wembley Stadium in London, Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015. Spectators pose for photos on Wembley Way as they arrive for the NFL game between Buffalo Bills and Jacksonville Jaguars at Wembley Stadium in London, Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015. Photo: Tim Ireland, AP The Latest from NFL Week 7: An experiment with streaming 1  /  1 Back to Gallery The latest from NFL games around the league on the seventh Sunday of the season (all times EDT):
9:30 a.m.
Kevin Harlan and Rich Gannon typically call games for CBS, but on this particular football Sunday, their microphones say "NFL on Yahoo."
The league is experimenting with streaming the matchup between the Buffalo Bills and Jacksonville Jaguars from London. With kickoff at 9:30 a.m. EDT, it is available only through Yahoo outside of the teams' home cities, not just within the United States but around the world.
The NFL wants to figure out whether there's significant money to be made in distributing games "over the top" â€” streaming them directly to fans. Yahoo and other tech companies such as Google and Apple could be future partners in how the league broadcasts the sport, to go along with its traditional deals with the television networks.
Viewers in Buffalo and Jacksonville are able to watch Sunday on their local CBS stations. Everywhere else, anyone with an Internet connection can see the game for free. The stream is available on any device through various Yahoo properties, including Tumblr, and the NFL's website and app.
Fans are still able to watch on their televisions if they own connected devices or sets.
___
